Uses of Class
jparsec.astrophysics.MeasureElement

  • Packages that use MeasureElement 
    Package Description
    jparsec.astrophysics
    Classes to operate with measurements and spectra in astrophysics.
    jparsec.astrophysics.photometry
    Classes to operate with astrophysical fluxes and photometric bands of instruments.
    jparsec.graph
    Creates charts using JFreeChart, SGT, VISAD, SurfacePlotter, and JMathPlot.
    jparsec.math
    Tools to apply different common math operations in astrophysics.
    jparsec.vo
    Classes to provide Virtual Observatory services.

    • Uses of MeasureElement in jparsec.astrophysics

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static MeasureElement MeasureElement.AMU
      Atomic unit mass, or 1/12 of the mass of the C-12 isotope, in Kg.
      static MeasureElement MeasureElement.AVOGADRO_CONSTANT
      Avogadro number in mol^-1.
      static MeasureElement MeasureElement.BOHR_MAGNETON
      Bohr's magneton in MeV/T.

      Bohr radius in m.

      Boltzmann constant in J/K.

      Electron charge in C (=> J/eV).

      Electron mass in Kg.

      Classical radius of the electron in m.

      Fine structure constant.

      Gas constant in J / (mol K).

      Gravitational constant in m^3/(kg s^2).

      Planck constant in J*s.

      Proton mass in Kg.

      Rydberg constant in m^-1.

      molar volume of an ideal gas in m^3/mol.
      static MeasureElement MeasureElement.WIEN_CONSTANT
      Wien constant in m K.
      MeasureElement FluxElement.x
      Wavelength/velocity value.
      MeasureElement FluxElement.y
      Flux value.

    • Uses of MeasureElement in jparsec.math

      Methods in jparsec.math that return MeasureElement 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      MeasureElement[] LinearFit.getMaximumCorrelation(LinearFit.MAX_CORRELATION mc, double minV, double maxV, double step)
      Searches for the maximum correlation in the input data by modifying the range of that data (x or y values) and considering only points with x or y greater or lower than a given range of values.
      MeasureElement MeanValue.getMeasuredAverageValue()
      Returns a simple average value using the average value as measure, and the dispersion as error.
      MeasureElement MeanValue.getMeasuredMeanValue()
      Returns most probable value of the magnitude based on each measurement and their errors.
